summary.span: Represents a Windows combo box control.

span.span: Represents a Windows combo box control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 一个显示的文本框中结合，这使用户能够从列表中选择项或输入新值。A displays a text box combined with a , which enables the user to select items from the list or enter a new value. 属性指定是否始终显示在列表或是否列表显示在下拉列表中。The property specifies whether the list is always displayed or whether the list is displayed in a drop-down. 属性还指定是否可以编辑的文本部分。The property also specifies whether the text portion can be edited. 请参阅可用设置和它们的影响。See for the available settings and their effects. 没有可始终显示列表不允许输入新值的设置。There is no setting to always display the list and disallow entering a new value. 若要显示可向其添加任何新值的列表，请使用控件。To display a list to which no new values can be added, use a control. 若要添加或删除列表中的对象，在运行时，使用的方法类 (通过属性的)。To add or remove objects in the list at run time, use methods of the class (through the property of the ). 可以分配与对象引用的数组方法。You can assign an array of object references with the method. 然后，列表显示每个对象的默认字符串值。The list then displays the default string value for each object. 您可以添加具有单个对象方法。You can add individual objects with the method. 您可以删除与项目方法或清除整个列表与方法。You can delete items with the method or clear the entire list with the method. 显示和选择功能，除了还提供了多种功能，可有效地将项添加到和查找在列表的项中的文本。In addition to display and selection functionality, the also provides features that enable you to efficiently add items to the and to find text within the items of the list. 与并方法，可以添加大量项到而无需每次都重新绘制控件项添加到列表。With the and methods, you can add a large number of items to the without the control being repainted each time an item is added to the list. 和方法，您可以搜索包含特定的搜索字符串的列表中的项。The and methods enable you to search for an item in the list that contains a specific search string. 可以使用这些属性来管理在列表中，当前选定的项属性来指定在编辑栏中显示的字符串属性来获取或设置当前项和属性来获取或设置引用的对象。You can use these properties to manage the currently selected item in the list, the property to specify the string displayed in the editing field, the property to get or set the current item, and the property to get or set a reference to the object. > [!NOTE] > 如果有， ，或在基础 Windows 窗体页上，并且想要修改这些控件派生窗体中的字符串集合，这些基窗体控件中的字符串集合必须为空。If you have a , , or on a base Windows Forms page and want to modify the string collections of those controls in a derived form, the string collections of those controls in the base form must be empty. 如果不为空字符串集合，它们将成为只读的派生另一个窗体时。If the string collections are not empty, they become read-only when you derive another form. ## Examples 下面的代码示例是一个完整的应用程序，显示如何使用方法将项添加到，则方法来查找中的项，并和方法有效地添加大量项到。The following code example is a complete application showing how you can use the method to add items to a , the method to find items in a , and the and methods to efficiently add a large number items to a . 能够存储不同于显示的文本的值继承自。The ability to store values that are different from displayed text is inherited from . 有关如何使用此功能的示例，请参阅类。For an example of how to use this feature, see the class. 必须添加对`System.Drawing`和`System.Windows.Forms`要运行此示例中的命名空间。You must add references to the `System.Drawing` and `System.Windows.Forms` namespaces to run this example. remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用， ，并属性，以创建的自动完成输入的字符串进行比较所输入的前缀中维护源的所有字符串的前缀。Use the , , and properties to create a that automatically completes input strings by comparing the prefix being entered to the prefixes of all strings in a maintained source. 这可用于控件中的 Url、 地址、 文件的名称或命令将经常输入。This is useful for controls in which URLs, addresses, file names, or commands will be frequently entered. 如果维护源中有重复项，自动完成行为不可预知。If there are duplicate entries in the maintained source, automatic completion behaves unpredictably. 利用属性是可选的但必须设置属性设置为`CustomSource`若要使用。The use of the property is optional, but you must set the property to `CustomSource` in order to use . 必须使用和属性组合在一起。You must use the and properties together. > [!NOTE] > 操作系统可能会限制可以同时显示的自定义字符串数。The operating system might limit the number of custom strings that it can display at once. 包含正斜杠 （/） 或反斜杠 (\\)，自动完成将追加仅直至并包括反斜杠的所有字符。For strings that contain a forward slash (/) or backward slash (\\), automatic completion appends all characters only up to and including the slash.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用， ，并属性，以创建的自动完成输入的字符串进行比较所输入的前缀中维护源的所有字符串的前缀。Use the , , and properties to create a that automatically completes input strings by comparing the prefix being entered to the prefixes of all strings in a maintained source. 这可用于控件中的 Url、 地址、 文件的名称或命令将经常输入。This is useful for controls in which URLs, addresses, file names, or commands will be frequently entered. 如果维护源中有重复项，自动完成行为不可预知。If there are duplicate entries in the maintained source, automatic completion behaves unpredictably. 如果您设置到，才会显示列表是或。If you set to , the list displays only if is or . 利用属性是可选的但必须设置属性设置为若要使用。The use of the property is optional, but you must set the property to in order to use . 必须使用和属性组合在一起。You must use the and properties together. 与设置为并设置为，行为如下所示：With set to and set to , the behavior is as follows: - 如果字符串的列表为空，按 BACKSPACE 或 DELETE 键不执行任何操作。If the list of strings is empty, pressing the BACKSPACE or DELETE key does nothing. - 如果小于一秒内按 BACKSPACE 键，选择上一项，或未选择任何项的字符串列表是否为空。If the BACKSPACE key is pressed in less than one second, the previous item is selected, or nothing is selected if the list of string is empty. - 如果超过一秒内按 BACKSPACE 键，则选择第一个项。If the BACKSPACE key is pressed in more than one second, the first item is selected. - 如果按下 DELETE 键，则选择第一个项。If the DELETE key is pressed, the first item is selected. > [!NOTE] > 操作系统可能会限制可以同时显示的自定义字符串数。The operating system might limit the number of custom strings that it can display at once. 包含正斜杠 （/） 或反斜杠 (\\)，自动完成将追加仅直至并包括反斜杠的所有字符。For strings that contain a forward slash (/) or backward slash (\\), automatic completion appends all characters only up to and including the slash.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法阻止直到绘制用户控件调用方法。This method prevents the control from painting until the method is called. 若要将项添加到的首选的方式是使用方法类 (通过属性)。The preferred way to add items to the is to use the method of the class (through the property of the ). 这使您一次向列表添加项的数组。This enables you to add an array of items to the list at one time. 但是，如果你想要添加项时使用的其中一个方法类，可以使用方法，以防止重新绘制控件每次向列表添加项。However, if you want to add items one at a time using the method of the class, you can use the method to prevent the control from repainting the each time an item is added to the list. 完成将项添加到列表的任务后，调用方法，以使重绘。Once you have completed the task of adding items to the list, call the method to enable the to repaint. 将项添加的这种方式可以防止在绘制过程闪烁大量的项添加到列表时。This way of adding items can prevent flicker during the drawing of the when a large number of items are being added to the list. ## Examples 下面的代码示例显示的使用情况和方法。The following code example shows the usage of the and methods. 此示例中的一个完整的代码示例摘自类概述。The example is part of a complete code example in the class overview. remarks.format: ## Remarks 调用此方法由公共`Dispose`方法和方法。This method is called by the public `Dispose` method and the method. `Dispose` 调用受保护`Dispose(Boolean)`方法替换`disposing`参数设置为`true`。`Dispose` invokes the protected `Dispose(Boolean)` method with the `disposing` parameter set to `true`. 调用`Dispose`与`disposing`设置为`false`。 invokes `Dispose` with `disposing` set to `false`. 当 `disposing` 参数为 `true` 时，此方法释放该 引用的、由任何托管对象持有的全部资源。When the `disposing` parameter is `true`, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this references. 此方法调用每个引用对象的 `Dispose` 方法。This method invokes the `Dispose` method of each referenced object.

span.para: 可以多次调用由其他对象。重写时小心不要引用已经释放的早期调用中的对象。详细了解如何实现，请参阅 [实现 Dispose Method](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md)。有关详细信息并，请参阅 [清理了非托管 Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md) 和 [重写 Finalize 方法] (http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/8026cb68-fe93-43fc-96c1-c09ad7d64cd3)。

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此事件由一个所有者描述。This event is used by an owner-drawn . 可以使用此事件来执行所需绘制项的任务。You can use this event to perform the tasks needed to draw items in the . 如果您有大小可变的项 (时属性设置为`OwnerDrawVariable`的值)，在绘制项前,引发事件。If you have a variable sized item (when the property is set to the `OwnerDrawVariable` value of ), before drawing an item, the event is raised. 可以创建的事件处理程序事件以指定要绘制在事件处理程序中的项的大小事件。You can create an event handler for the event to specify the size for the item that you are going to draw in your event handler for the event. 有关处理事件的详细信息，请参阅[处理和引发事件](~/docs/standard/events/index.md)。For more information about handling events, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/docs/standard/events/index.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何通过设置创建一个所有者描述的组合框属性设置为`OwnerDrawnVariable`和处理和事件。The following code example demonstrates how to create an owner-drawn combo box by setting the property to `OwnerDrawnVariable` and handling the and events. 它还演示如何设置和属性。It also demonstrates setting the and properties. 若要运行该示例，请在窗体中粘贴以下代码。To run the example, paste the following code in a form. 调用`InitializeComboBox`窗体的构造函数中的方法或事件。Call the `InitializeComboBox` method in the form's constructor or event. remarks.format: ## Remarks 若要将项添加到的首选的方式是使用方法类 (通过属性)。The preferred way to add items to the is to use the method of the class (through the property of the ). 这使您一次向列表添加项的数组。This enables you to add an array of items to the list at one time. 但是，如果你想要添加项时使用的其中一个方法类，可以使用方法，以防止重新绘制控件每次向列表添加项。However, if you want to add items one at a time using the method of the class, you can use the method to prevent the control from repainting the each time an item is added to the list. 完成将项添加到列表的任务后，调用方法，以使重绘。Once you have completed the task of adding items to the list, call the method to enable the to repaint. 这种方法添加项可以防止闪烁的绘图大量的项添加到列表时。This way of adding items can prevent flickered drawing of the when a large number of items are being added to the list. ## Examples 下面的代码示例显示的使用情况和方法。The following code example shows the usage of the and methods. 此示例摘自中的代码示例类概述。The example is part of a code example in the class overview. remarks.format: ## Remarks 此属性使您能够获取对当前存储中的项列表的引用。This property enables you to obtain a reference to the list of items that are currently stored in the . 与此引用，可以将项添加、 删除项，并获取集合中项的计数。With this reference, you can add items, remove items, and obtain a count of the items in the collection. 尽管是通常用于显示文本的项，您可以将任何对象添加到。Although the is typically used to display text items, you can add any object to the . 通常情况下中的对象的表示形式是由该对象返回的字符串方法。Typically, the representation of an object in the is the string returned by that object's method. 如果你想要改为显示的对象的成员，选择将显示的设置的成员属性设置为适当的成员的名称。If you want to have a member of the object displayed instead, choose the member that will be displayed by setting the property to the name of the appropriate member. 你还可以选择将表示该对象通过设置返回的值的对象的成员属性。You can also choose a member of the object that will represent the value returned by the object by setting the property. 有关详细信息，请参阅。For more information, see . 有关可使用项集合执行的任务的详细信息，请参阅类参考主题。For more information about the tasks that can be performed with the item collection, see the class reference topics. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何添加少量的项。The following code example demonstrates how to add a small number of items. 如果需要添加大量项，请参阅在示例。If you need to add a large number of items, see the example at . 这两个示例是中提供一个更大示例的一部分类概述。Both examples are part of a larger example available in the class overview. span.para: 重写时在派生类中，请务必调用基类的方法，以便已注册的委托接收事件。

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此属性指示组合框列表中的当前选定项的从零开始的索引。This property indicates the zero-based index of the currently selected item in the combo box list. 设置新的索引将引发事件。Setting a new index raises the event. ，和相关，如下所示：, , and are related as follows: - 如果是`false`，将不会设置为-1为空。If is `false`, will not be set to -1 when is blank. - 如果是`true`，将设置为-1 时为空。If is `true`, will be set to -1 when is blank. > [!NOTE] > 若要取消选择当前所选的项，设置为-1。To deselect the currently selected item, set the to -1. 不能设置的项为-1，如果该项是数据绑定项。You cannot set the of a item to -1 if the item is a data-bound item. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何使用方法和属性。The following code example show how to use the method and property. 此示例摘自的完整示例中类概述。The example is part of a complete example in the class overview. remarks.format: ## Remarks 可以使用属性来检索或更改当前所选的文本中控件。You can use the property to retrieve or change the currently selected text in a control. 但是，应注意所选内容，可以自动更改由于用户交互。However, you should be aware that the selection can change automatically because of user interaction. 例如，如果您检索按钮中的值事件处理程序，值将为空字符串。For example, if you retrieve the value in a button event handler, the value will be an empty string. 这是因为输入的焦点从组合框移到按钮时，会自动清除所选内容。This is because the selection is automatically cleared when the input focus moves from the combo box to the button. 当组合框失去焦点时，选择点移动到文本的开头和任何所选的文本变为未选中状态。When the combo box loses focus, the selection point moves to the beginning of the text and any selected text becomes unselected. 在这种情况下，获取属性检索空字符串，并设置属性将指定的值添加到文本的开头。In this case, getting the property retrieves an empty string, and setting the property adds the specified value to the beginning of the text. 当组合框获得焦点时，会自动选择控件中的完整文本。When the combo box gains focus, the full text in the control is automatically selected. 如果调用控件的方法以设置输入的焦点的完整文本选择无论是否在控件已具有焦点。If you call the control's method to set the input focus, the full text is selected regardless of whether the control already had focus. 当用户选择某个项，从下拉列表或通过使用向上键和向下箭头键时，会自动选择新项的文本。When the user selects an item from the drop-down list or by using the UP ARROW and DOWN ARROW keys, the text for the new item is automatically selected. 但是，如果尝试获取中的值或事件处理程序，该属性返回空字符串。However, if you try to get the value in a or event handler, the property returns an empty string. 这是因为，在这些事件时的上一个清除值和新值尚未设置。This is because, at the time of these events, the previous value has been cleared and the new value has not yet been set. 若要检索中的当前值或事件处理程序，使用属性改为。To retrieve the current value in a or event handler, use the property instead.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 仅当用户更改组合框选择，并可以创建此事件来提供的特殊处理的处理程序时引发事件时用户更改列表中的选定的项。The event is raised only when the user changes the combo box selection, and you can create a handler for this event to provide special handling for the when the user changes the selected item in the list. 但是，具体取决于如何配置，以及用户如何更改所选的项目，可能不会引发事件。However, depending on how the is configured, and how the user changes the selected item, the event may not be raised. 或者，可以处理，但请注意，会发生此事件，以编程方式或由用户是否更改索引。Alternatively, you can handle the , but note that this event occurs whether the index is changed programmatically or by the user. 有关处理事件的详细信息，请参阅[处理和引发事件](~/docs/standard/events/index.md)。For more information about handling events, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/docs/standard/events/index.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例使用事件和属性可以更改文本框中，具体取决于用户已选择并提交的长度。The following code example uses the event and the property to change the length of the text box depending on what the user has selected and committed. remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果控件中不选择任何文本，则此属性指示新的文本的插入点。If no text is selected in the control, this property indicates the insertion point for new text. 如果将此属性设置控件中的文本的长度之外的位置，选择开始位置位于最后一个字符后。If you set this property to a location beyond the length of the text in the control, the selection start position is placed after the last character. 文本框控件中选定文本后，更改此属性可以释放的值属性。When text is selected in the text box control, changing this property can release the value of the property. 如果所指示的位置之后控件中的剩余文本属性小于的值属性、 的值属性会自动减小。If the remaining text in the control after the position indicated by the property is less than the value of the property, the value of the property is automatically decreased. 值属性将永远不会导致在增加属性。The value of the property never causes an increase in the property. > [!NOTE] > 返回当前所选内容的较低值。 returns the lower value of the current selection. 例如，`Select(10, -4)`选择从字符位置 6 到 10 的字符位置的文本。For example, `Select(10, -4)` selects the text from character position 6 through character position 10. 如果你将获得值，它将是 6，而不是 10。If you now get the value, it will be 6 rather than 10.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此属性指定是否对现有条目进行排序并将新条目添加到列表中的适当排序位置。This property specifies whether the sorts existing entries and add new entries to the appropriate sorted position in the list. 可以使用此属性进行自动排序中的项。You can use this property to automatically sort items in a . 将项目添加到一个经过排序，项目移动到已排序的列表中的相应位置。As items are added to a sorted , the items are moved to the appropriate location in the sorted list. 将属性设置为`false`，新项添加到现有列表的末尾。When you set the property to `false`, new items are added to the end of the existing list. 排序是区分大小写且按字母顺序升序排序。The sort is case-insensitive and in alphabetically ascending order. 尝试设置上的数据绑定控件的属性引发。Attempting to set the property on a data-bound control raises an . 必须对使用基础数据模型的数据进行排序。You must sort the data using the underlying data model.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 所有消息都发送到方法通过进行筛选后的方法。All messages are sent to the method after getting filtered through the method. 方法与 Windows `WindowProc` 函数完全对应。The method corresponds exactly to the Windows `WindowProc` function. 有关处理 Windows 消息的详细信息，请参阅`WindowProc`函数中的 Windows Platform SDK 参考的文档位于 MSDN library http://msdn.microsoft.com/library。For more information about processing Windows messages, see the `WindowProc` function documentation in the Windows Platform SDK reference located in the MSDN library at http://msdn.microsoft.com/library. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何重写方法以处理操作系统消息中标识结构。The following code example demonstrates overriding the method to handle operating system messages identified in the structure. 在此示例中了解另一个应用程序将变为活动状态时处理 WM_ACTIVATEAPP 操作系统消息。The WM_ACTIVATEAPP operating system message is handled in this example to know when another application is becoming active. 请参阅位于 MSDN library 的 Platform SDK 文档参考http://msdn.microsoft.com/library若要了解可用， ，和值。Refer to the Platform SDK documentation reference located in the MSDN library at http://msdn.microsoft.com/library to understand the available , , and values. 可以在 MSDN 库中也是可用平台 SDK （Core SDK 部分） 下载中包含 Windows.h 标头文件中找到实际的常量值http://msdn.microsoft.com/library。Actual constant values can be found in the Windows.h header file included in the Platform SDK (Core SDK section) download, which is also available in the MSDN library at http://msdn.microsoft.com/library.
